title: Nonideal battery - power - 6V battery and 3ish ohm

content.description: A nonideal battery has an <math alttext="e m f" overflow="scroll"><mi>emf</mi></math> of <math alttext="6.0 volts" overflow="scroll"> <mn>6.0</mn> <mspace width="0.2em"> </mspace> <mtext>V</mtext> </math> and an internal resistance of <math alttext="0.7 ohm" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.7</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">Ω</mi></math>. The battery is connected to a <math alttext="3.3 ohm" overflow="scroll"><mn>3.3</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">Ω</mi></math> resistor, as shown in the figure.
content.question: What is the power dissipated in the <math alttext="3.3 ohm" overflow="scroll"> <mn>3.3</mn> <mspace width="0.2em"> </mspace> <mi mathvariant="normal">Ω</mi> </math> resistor?

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
